N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7350.7 - Sanitation inspections

State Regulations
(a) The
director shall require weekly sanitation inspections of all facility areas by a
designated staff member. The results of each inspection shall be recorded in
writing. (b) Each facility shall be
inspected annually by State or local sanitation and health officials to ensure
compliance with all applicable laws and regulations. The results of each
inspection shall be recorded in writing, together with a summary of any action
taken to address any deficiencies, and maintained on file at the facility. There shall be documentation that deficiencies have been corrected. Such
inspections conducted pursuant to this subdivision shall be designed to require
compliance with the requirements of this Part and with the applicable
provisions of the State's Sanitary Code, set forth in Chapter I of Title 10
NYCRR. (c) The director shall
require that the facility's potable water source, whether owned or operated by
the public water department or by the facility, is certified in compliance with
applicable laws and regulations. Notes
